translated: Birth Stories🔽The Dukanipāta🔽The Chapter on the Unequalled
Jātaka: The Group of Discourses, Chapter 1, The Story of the Unequalled One🔽The Story of the Horse-Dealer
“The water is little, the taste is poor, and it is low,
Having drunk it, intoxication is born in the asses;
But having drunk this excellent taste,
Intoxication is not born in the Sindhu horses.”
“Having drunk little, the one of low birth,
He is intoxicated by it, O Lord of the People, when asked;
But the one of good conduct and noble birth,

analyzed: na majjatī agga rasam pivitvā ati
translated: Is not intoxicated by drinking the best taste.”
The Story of the Horse-Dealer, the third.
